params.name: id
params.description: guild id

params.name: name
params.description: guild name (2-100 characters, excluding trailing and leading whitespace)

params.name: icon
params.description: [icon hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting)

params.name: icon_hash?
params.description: [icon hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting), returned when in the template object

params.name: splash
params.description: [splash hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting)

params.name: discovery_splash
params.description: [discovery splash hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting); only present for guilds with the "DISCOVERABLE" feature

params.name: owner? \*\*
params.description: true if [the user](#DOCS_RESOURCES_USER/get-current-user-guilds) is the owner of the guild

params.name: owner_id
params.description: id of owner

params.name: permissions? \*\*
params.description: total permissions for [the user](#DOCS_RESOURCES_USER/get-current-user-guilds) in the guild (excludes overwrites)

params.name: region? \*\*\*
params.description: [voice region](#DOCS_RESOURCES_VOICE/voice-region-object) id for the guild (deprecated)

params.name: afk_channel_id
params.description: id of afk channel

params.name: afk_timeout
params.description: afk timeout in seconds

params.name: widget_enabled?
params.description: true if the server widget is enabled

params.name: widget_channel_id?
params.description: the channel id that the widget will generate an invite to, or `null` if set to no invite

params.name: verification_level
params.description: [verification level](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/guild-object-verification-level) required for the guild

params.name: default_message_notifications
params.description: default [message notifications level](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/guild-object-default-message-notification-level)

params.name: explicit_content_filter
params.description: [explicit content filter level](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/guild-object-explicit-content-filter-level)

params.name: roles
params.description: roles in the guild

params.name: emojis
params.description: custom guild emojis

params.name: features
params.description: enabled guild features

params.name: mfa_level
params.description: required [MFA level](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/guild-object-mfa-level) for the guild

params.name: application_id
params.description: application id of the guild creator if it is bot-created

params.name: system_channel_id
params.description: the id of the channel where guild notices such as welcome messages and boost events are posted

params.name: system_channel_flags
params.description: [system channel flags](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/guild-object-system-channel-flags)

params.name: rules_channel_id
params.description: the id of the channel where Community guilds can display rules and/or guidelines

params.name: joined_at? \*
params.description: when this guild was joined at

params.name: large? \*
params.description: true if this is considered a large guild

params.name: unavailable? \*
params.description: true if this guild is unavailable due to an outage

params.name: member_count? \*
params.description: total number of members in this guild

params.name: voice_states? \*
params.description: states of members currently in voice channels; lacks the `guild_id` key

params.name: members? \*
params.description: users in the guild

params.name: channels? \*
params.description: channels in the guild

params.name: threads? \*
params.description: all active threads in the guild that current user has permission to view

params.name: presences? \*
params.description: presences of the members in the guild, will only include non-offline members if the size is greater than `large threshold`

params.name: max_presences?
params.description: the maximum number of presences for the guild (`null` is always returned, apart from the largest of guilds)

params.name: max_members?
params.description: the maximum number of members for the guild

params.name: vanity_url_code
params.description: the vanity url code for the guild

params.name: description
params.description: the description of a Community guild

params.name: banner
params.description: [banner hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting)

params.name: premium_tier
params.description: [premium tier](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/guild-object-premium-tier) (Server Boost level)

params.name: premium_subscription_count?
params.description: the number of boosts this guild currently has

params.name: preferred_locale
params.description: the preferred [locale](#DOCS_REFERENCE/locales) of a Community guild; used in server discovery and notices from Discord, and sent in interactions; defaults to "en-US"

params.name: public_updates_channel_id
params.description: the id of the channel where admins and moderators of Community guilds receive notices from Discord

params.name: max_video_channel_users?
params.description: the maximum amount of users in a video channel

params.name: approximate_member_count?
params.description: approximate number of members in this guild, returned from the `GET /guilds/<id>` endpoint when `with_counts` is `true`

params.name: approximate_presence_count?
params.description: approximate number of non-offline members in this guild, returned from the `GET /guilds/<id>` endpoint when `with_counts` is `true`

params.name: welcome_screen?
params.description: the welcome screen of a Community guild, shown to new members, returned in an [Invite](#DOCS_RESOURCES_INVITE/invite-object)'s guild object

params.name: nsfw_level
params.description: [guild NSFW level](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/guild-object-guild-nsfw-level)

params.name: stage_instances? \*
params.description: Stage instances in the guild

params.name: stickers?
params.description: custom guild stickers

params.name: guild_scheduled_events? \*
params.description: the scheduled events in the guild

params.name: premium_progress_bar_enabled
params.description: whether the guild has the boost progress bar enabled

params.name: id
params.description: guild id

params.name: name
params.description: guild name (2-100 characters)

params.name: icon
params.description: [icon hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting)

params.name: splash
params.description: [splash hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting)

params.name: discovery_splash
params.description: [discovery splash hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting)

params.name: emojis
params.description: custom guild emojis

params.name: features
params.description: enabled guild features

params.name: approximate_member_count
params.description: approximate number of members in this guild

params.name: approximate_presence_count
params.description: approximate number of online members in this guild

params.name: description
params.description: the description for the guild, if the guild is discoverable

params.name: stickers
params.description: custom guild stickers

params.name: enabled
params.description: whether the widget is enabled

params.name: channel_id
params.description: the widget channel id

params.name: id
params.description: guild id

params.name: name
params.description: guild name (2-100 characters)

params.name: instant_invite
params.description: instant invite for the guilds specified widget invite channel

params.name: channels
params.description: voice and stage channels which are accessible by @everyone

params.name: members
params.description: special widget user objects that includes users presence (Limit 100)

params.name: presence_count
params.description: number of online members in this guild

params.name: user?
params.description: the user this guild member represents

params.name: nick?
params.description: this user's guild nickname

params.name: avatar?
params.description: the member's [guild avatar hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting)

params.name: roles
params.description: array of [role](#DOCS_TOPICS_PERMISSIONS/role-object) object ids

params.name: joined_at
params.description: when the user joined the guild

params.name: premium_since?
params.description: when the user started [boosting](https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360028038352-Server-Boosting-) the guild

params.name: deaf
params.description: whether the user is deafened in voice channels

params.name: mute
params.description: whether the user is muted in voice channels

params.name: pending?
params.description: whether the user has not yet passed the guild's [Membership Screening](#DOCS_RESOURCES_GUILD/membership-screening-object) requirements

params.name: permissions?
params.description: total permissions of the member in the channel, including overwrites, returned when in the interaction object

params.name: communication_disabled_until?
params.description: when the user's [timeout](https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/4413305239191-Time-Out-FAQ) will expire and the user will be able to communicate in the guild again, null or a time in the past if the user is not timed out

params.name: id
params.description: integration id

params.name: name
params.description: integration name

params.name: type
params.description: integration type (twitch, youtube, or discord)

params.name: enabled
params.description: is this integration enabled

params.name: syncing? \*
params.description: is this integration syncing

params.name: role_id? \*
params.description: id that this integration uses for "subscribers"

params.name: enable_emoticons? \*
params.description: whether emoticons should be synced for this integration (twitch only currently)

params.name: expire_behavior? \*
params.description: the behavior of expiring subscribers

params.name: expire_grace_period? \*
params.description: the grace period (in days) before expiring subscribers

params.name: user? \*
params.description: user for this integration

params.name: account
params.description: integration account information

params.name: synced_at? \*
params.description: when this integration was last synced

params.name: subscriber_count? \*
params.description: how many subscribers this integration has

params.name: revoked? \*
params.description: has this integration been revoked

params.name: application?
params.description: The bot/OAuth2 application for discord integrations

params.name: id
params.description: id of the account

params.name: name
params.description: name of the account

params.name: id
params.description: the id of the app

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the app

params.name: icon
params.description: the [icon hash](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting) of the app

params.name: description
params.description: the description of the app

params.name: summary
params.description: the summary of the app

params.name: bot?
params.description: the bot associated with this application

params.name: reason
params.description: the reason for the ban

params.name: user
params.description: the banned user

params.name: description
params.description: the server description shown in the welcome screen

params.name: welcome_channels
params.description: the channels shown in the welcome screen, up to 5

params.name: channel_id
params.description: the channel's id

params.name: description
params.description: the description shown for the channel

params.name: emoji_id
params.description: the [emoji id](#DOCS_REFERENCE/image-formatting), if the emoji is custom

params.name: emoji_name
params.description: the emoji name if custom, the unicode character if standard, or `null` if no emoji is set
